bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Leatha Logan, March 20, 1942

div1.p: Hench thanks Logan for the photograph of Carter and explains the discrepancy in the number of experimental yellow fever cases that she pointed out in his article.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Leatha Logan, March 20, 1942
div1.opener:
March 20, 1942
Miss L. Logan
1505 W. Nelson Street
Marion, Indiana
My dear Miss Logan:
div1.p:
The discrepancies between my paper and your
understanding of the number of volunteers arises from
the fact that I closed my story with the closing of Camp
Lazear and did not include Mr. Bullard, and the several
other cases experimented on by Dr. Carroll in the Fall
of 1901, which cases, however, are included in the formal
reports and Senate Doorment, etc.

Thank you very kindly for permitting me to
keep Dr. Carter's picture.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
